section.p:
As the Taglets are part of the the larger
Toolkit for Java
it shares a section of the Docfacto.xml. The configuration simply enables certain taglets to be enabled. In the example below, the system-taglet is not enabled, so no docfacto.system taglet information will be displayed.
The since-taglet takes an extra value, which is the value to highlight. This feature allows the developer to quickly see what has been added at the latest release

section.title: User defined Taglets
section.p:
It is possible to specify custom / user defined Taglets within the configuration XML file. These Taglets will be automatically registered with the Javadoc engine with the name supplied. It is recommended by Oracle / Sun that custom taglets have a . in the name, as how are all of the
ones. The specified class must implement the com.sun.tools.doclets.Taglet interface.
